articles.title: This Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stock Is Up 89% Over the Past Year. Here's 1 Crucial Metric Investors Will Want to Watch in 2025.
articles.author: Courtney Carlsen
articles.summary: Lemonade (NYSE: LMND) is at the forefront of AI-driven disruption in the insurance industry. The company has increased its areas of coverage and expanded rapidly, but it has struggled with profitability. In the third quarter, Lemonade lost $67.7 million compared to the $61.5 million loss from the previous year. Its net loss ratio was 81%, slightly higher than in previous quarters but down from previous years.

articles.title: This Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stock Is Up 89% Over the Past Year. Here's 1 Crucial Metric Investors Will Want to Watch in 2025.
articles.author: Courtney Carlsen
articles.summary: Lemonade (NYSE: LMND) is at the forefront of AI-driven disruption in the insurance industry. The company streamlines the entire customer experience by employing AI chatbots, from obtaining quotes and purchasing policies to efficiently and quickly settling claims. Lemonade's in-force premium has grown from $609 million to $889 million, or 45%, and it now has 2.3 million customers. However, it continues to lose money as its sales and expenses rise.

articles.title: Researchers Open Source Sky-T1: A $450 Reasoning AI Model Competing with OpenAI's o1
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Sky-T1-32B-Preview is an open-source reasoning AI model. It was trained in 19 hours using 8 Nvidia H100 GPUs. It outperformed an early version of OpenAI's o1 on MATH500 and excelled in coding challenges from livecodebench. Dr. Elena Martinez, a leading AI researcher and developer at NeuroTech AI, discussed the ethical dimensions of AI.

articles.title: UK will not pit AI safety against investment in bid for growth, says minister
articles.author: Christopher McKeon
articles.summary: Peter Kyle is set to unveil the Government's plans for AI on Monday. He wants to attract tech investment without weakening online safety standards. The launch of the AI action plan comes as major American tech companies are aligning themselves with incoming US president Donald Trump and pushing back against regulation.

articles.title: Blue-blooded tech firm Afiniti files for bankruptcy
articles.author: The Daily Mail
articles.summary: Afiniti was founded in 2005 and provides artificial intelligence software to call centres. It employed Princess Beatrice. It was forced into bankruptcy proceedings at the back end of last year, The Mail on Sunday can reveal. It is now in liquidation proceedings.

articles.title: Nvidia Nemotron Models: Accelerating AI Agent Development with LLMs and VLMs
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Nemotron Model Families are a suite of advanced AI tools designed to power the next generation of enterprise applications. They include the Llama Nemotron large language models (LLMs) and the Cosmos Nemotrons VLMs. They are available in three sizes to cater to different computational needs: Nano for PC applications, Super for single-GPU setups and Ultra for data-center-scale operations.

articles.title: Hallucinations from artificial intelligence speed up scientific discoveries
articles.author: Lu Staff
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence sometimes makes up information that appears to be factual, known as hallucinations. These hallucinations are useful during the early stages of scientific research. They speed up the process by which scientists and inventors dream up new ideas and test them to see if reality concurs. In October, David Baker shared the Nobel Prize in Chemistry for his pioneering research on proteins.

articles.title: Qatar at the top in embracing innovation, says AI ambassador
articles.author: Gulf-Times
articles.summary: Abran Maldonado, Open AI Ambassador and expert in AI and the metaverse, gave an exclusive interview to Gulf Times on the future of AI and its transformative impact on society. He is confident that Qatar will be ahead of anybody else in that respect.

articles.title: The Dead Internet Theory is Gaining Traction Again, And AI Is Fueling It
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence has become a powerful tool for creating content at scale. Bad bots spread spam, launch cyberattacks, and manipulate public opinion online. The proliferation of bad bots has implications for online security and trust. Experts recommend staying vigilant and critically evaluating the content we encounter online.

articles.title: Is Meta Platforms' (META) AI Innovation the Key to Future Profits?
articles.author: Fahad Saleem
articles.summary: Anastasia Amoroso, iCapital chief investment officer, said in a latest program on CNBC that 2025 will be the year of AI software, data centers and power. Facebook has recently taken positive steps to enhance data protection. Meta Platforms (NASDAQ:META) is driving usage and ads revenue by improving its algorithms and user experience thanks to AI. The company's new large language model surpasses rivals.

articles.title: Lawyers must keep up with emerging tech, AI: Justice B Vijaysen Reddy
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Justice B Vijaysen Reddy of Telangana high court called on the advocates to use artificial intelligence in their research to provide quality justice to the people. He asked them to make use of AI in research and to use it in their advocacy work.

articles.title: Beatbot Brings the Heat to CES 2025 with Next-Level Pool Cleaning Tech
articles.author: Kyle J. Russell
articles.summary: Beatbot is a market leader in robotic pool cleaning technology. Beatbot's AquaSense 2 Series offers three new robotic pool cleaners: Standard, Pro, and Ultra. The Ultra is the world's first AI-powered 5-in-1 robotic pool cleaner with a suite of advanced features.

articles.title: Is Rigetti Computing (RGTI) Mirroring Wall Street Downturn?
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: Rigetti Computing, Inc. (NASDAQ:RGTI) tumbled by 11.06 percent on Friday, ending the week at $8.93 each. Rigetti Computing ranks 3rd on our list of companies mirroring Wall Street downturns.

articles.title: Did Nebius Group (NBIS) Close Shortened Trading Week Higher?
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: Nebius Group N.V. (NASDAQ:NBIS) grew its share price by 7.94 percent on Friday to finish at $33.18 each as investors resorted to bargain-hunting following a dip in the previous day's trading. Nvidia Corp. (NVDA), a leader in AI computing, has invested in Nebius.

articles.title: Mark Zuckerberg says AI could soon do the work of Meta's midlevel engineers
articles.author: Lakshmi Varanasi
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg said Meta will start automating the work of midlevel software engineers this year and eventually outsource all coding on its apps to AI. Meta also plans to replace fact-checkers with community notes and reduce DEI initiatives and bring back more political content.

articles.title: ChatGPT Is Under Attack For Its Use Of Water — But How Does That Even Work?
articles.author: Taylor Tobin
articles.summary: There are wildfires raging in Los Angeles. Angelenos should stop using ChatGPT to save water. AI platforms can't generate content without the help of massive data center servers. Data centers use a lot of water to cool down the servers. The current wildfires were caused in part by drought affecting Southern California.

articles.title: This wireless car adapter supports Apple CarPlay, Android Auto, and streaming
articles.author: Donna Enzmann
articles.summary: The PlayAIBox is a wireless adapter for Apple CarPlay and Android Auto. It pairs your smartphone to your car's system in seconds. Built-in streaming apps like Netflix, YouTube, and Disney+ transform your dashboard into an entertainment hub. It integrates seamlessly with navigation apps, like Google Maps and Waze. It's just $74.97 (reg. $129).

articles.title: These are the fastest-growing job titles, according to LinkedIn users
articles.author: Auzinea Bacon
articles.summary: LinkedIn studied millions of user updates from January 2022 to July 2024 to find the fastest-growing jobs for 2025. The top two jobs were artificial intelligence engineer and artificial intelligence consultant. The third job was physical therapist, the fourth was workforce development manager, and the fifth was travel advisor.

articles.title: Why Everyone — From Technologists To Creatives —Needs To Guide AI Design
articles.author: Joe McKendrick
articles.summary: James Landay, a professor of computer science at Stanford University, argues that the holistic design of AI systems up front is now the most important part of AI implementations. People from diverse professional backgrounds, from law to creative arts, need to be involved in AI design and development. It's urgent that it be a collaborative process as AI is reshaping our businesses, workplaces and society.

articles.title: 3 AI Myths That 2025 Will Debunk
articles.author: Nisha Talagala
articles.summary: In the last year or two, people have made many false assumptions about the AI revolution and how it works. In 2025, people will realize that AI Literacy also means understanding how AIs work. In 2024, people saw a growth in interest in using AI tools, but for many, it means knowing how they work.

articles.title: Perplexity AI vs Gemini Advanced Pro Deep Research
articles.author: The Manila Times
articles.summary: AI-powered tools like Perplexity and Google's Gemini Advanced Pro with Deep Research have replaced the need to type a keyword into a search engine and work through a lot of tabs to find insights from scattered links in the search results. It's no longer necessary to do this.

articles.title: Chick-fil-A Using Advanced Squeezing Robots to Conduct Huge Lemon Party
articles.summary: Chick-fil-A has built an armada of robots to squeeze citrus for its delectable lemonade. The Santa Clarita, California plant is home to driverless forklifts, gigantic mechanic lemon-grabbing arms, automated rollers, and even robotic reamers that deliver, drop, clean, and squeeze the fruits. The automation saves up to 10,000 hours of work per day. It also extracts oils for cosmetics and fragrance companies.

articles.title: Wall Street Could Slash Up to 200,000 Jobs Replaced by AI
articles.author: Lucas Nolan
articles.summary: Wall Street banks are expected to slash up to 200,000 jobs over the next three to five years due to the implementation of artificial intelligence. Banks have been investing heavily in modernizing their IT systems in the wake of the financial crisis, aiming to streamline processes and reduce costs. According to Bloomberg Intelligence, banks could see their pretax profits surge by 12 to 17 percent in 2027 due to AI.

articles.title: History Says the Nasdaq Will Soar in 2025. My 3 Top AI Stocks to Buy Before It Does.
articles.author: Adria Cimino
articles.summary: Last year, the Nasdaq rose 28%, while the S&P 500 rose 23%, and the Dow Jones Industrial Average increased 12%. The Nasdaq is heavily weighted in technology companies. The AI market is forecast to top $1 trillion by the end of the decade. AI technology has the potential to transform many industries and boost earnings. Alphabet, Meta Platforms and Nvidia are good AI stocks to buy before Nasdaq soars.

articles.title: Opinion: Personalized education for all is closer than you think
articles.author: Devin McCormick
articles.summary: The one-size-fits-all approach to education leaves many students behind. The future of education is the transformative power of artificial intelligence (AI). Utah has approved SchoolAI as an official software vendor. The app is meant to differentiate teaching among students and have a more interactive approach.

articles.title: I saw Razer's Project Ava in action and I'm convinced AI is ready to turn gaming on its head
articles.author: James Pero
articles.summary: Razer showed off its Project Ava concept at CES 2025 in Las Vegas. Ava uses AI to give real-time coaching for gamers. Laptop Mag's special issue features news, reviews, interviews and analysis of the best in consumer tech from CES 2025.

articles.title: California's New AI-Powered Detection Cameras Were Helpless Against The Palisades Fire
articles.author: Cyrus Farivar
articles.summary: Palisades Fire in western Los Angeles has burned over 20,000 acres and destroyed more than 9,000 homes and structures. It is being called the most destructive fire in the history of Los Angeles County and Wall Street analysts predict it will likely result in damages of tens of billions of dollars. Governor Gavin Newsom announced a slew of new initiatives intended to mitigate future catastrophes. Cal Fire has relied on a vast statewide network of over 1,100 publicly available video cameras to power its AI system.

articles.title: Prime Video's AI, Next Gen Stats on NFL games helps viewers understand the game
articles.author: Associated Press
articles.summary: Pittsburgh Steelers and Baltimore Ravens play on Prime Video on Saturday night. It's the third season doing NFL games with the 'Prime Vision' feed and use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in the broadcasts. The data used to fuel the AI models comes from the league's Next Gen Stats, which tracks players and provides analytics data.

articles.title: Subservience: Exploring the Myths and Realities of AI Evolution
articles.author: Geopolitics Unplugged
articles.summary: "Subservience" dramatizes AI capabilities far beyond current technological realities. The movie highlights concerns like AI autonomy, privacy, job displacement, and its impact on personal relationships. It emphasizes the need for responsible AI development, balancing innovation with ethical and societal considerations.

articles.title: Local View: Artificial intelligence shaping the world — for better or worse
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence has the potential to revolutionize industries, address global challenges and improve lives, but there are risks with this technology. Transparency is an essential starting point in thinking about policies for this technology, it must be explainable and auditable to gain public trust. Governments must implement clear, binding rules that ensure transparency from companies developing these technologies. Governments, companies and civil society must collaborate to establish ethical guidelines and incentivize the development of AI tools that benefit everyone.

articles.title: Working Strategies: Best practices for companies using AI
articles.author: Amy Lindgren
articles.summary: This is the fifth of 12 columns on AI and work for the Second Sunday series, which will appear the second Sunday of each month, from September through August. Last month's column provided tips on using ChatGPT. Previous columns looked at work opportunities with artificial intelligence, AI use in the hiring process and an overview of artificial intelligence in general. This month's topic is AI best practices for employers and managers.

articles.title: This Week's Awesome Tech Stories From Around the Web (Through January 11)
articles.author: Singularity Hub Staff
articles.summary: Google is forming a new team to build AI that can simulate the physical world. Nvidia Announces $3,000 Personal AI Supercomputer called Digits. Dreame's arm can pick up sneakers as large as men's size 42 and take them to a designated spot in your home. Scientists are designing computer programs that may unlock the ability to simulate human cells.

articles.title: How Dogs and AI Might Be the Key to Early Cancer Detection
articles.author: Sammi Caramela
articles.summary: Dogs and artificial intelligence helped SpotitEarly Ltd. develop a non-invasive screening method to detect cancer in exhaled breath samples from humans. Canines and AI were able to identify four different types of cancer in 94% of cases, even early cases.

articles.title: AI artist reimagines 'Friends' as a classic 1950s-style sitcom with the vintage voiceover and it's surreal
articles.summary: Saga Lore AI created a 2-minute video based on the American sitcom "Friends" using AI platforms like Midjourney AI and Runway AI. The video has been viewed almost 90,000 times in a month. It has received positive and humorous comments from AI enthusiasts and original show fans.

articles.title: "Companionship" Robot That Its Creator Says Is Definitely Not a Sex Robot Looks Around With a Dazed Expression
articles.summary: Robotics company Realbotix has shown off a life-sized robot called Aria at this year's Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas. CEO Andrew Kiguel claims that Aria is a "social" robot designed to "tackle the staggering loneliness epidemic" for hospitals and theme parks. Reddit users point out the company's unusual marketing tactic.

articles.summary: Tech industry leaders urge Biden not to cement rule that could diminish US global leadership on AI. Sam Altman's sister accused him of sexually abusing her for nearly a decade. Berkeley professor sees the impact of H-1B visas and AI on students' job opportunities. Top tech is stealing the show at CES 2025.

articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: MLVision has officially launched its groundbreaking MLVision M5 at CES 2025. It is the world's lightest AI-powered AR glasses weighing 25.8 grams. It combines cutting-edge artificial intelligence, precision engineering, and a commitment to privacy and accessibility.

articles.title: Letter: Recent ACES columns missed the boat on AI
articles.author: Amanda Armstrong
articles.summary: The Daily News' promotion of artificial intelligence data centers in two recent columns in The Daily News is in direct opposition to the Alliance for Climate and Environmental Stewards' protection of natural resources. AI's contributions to climate solutions will be far outweighed by its global energy and water needs.

articles.title: DUK develops AI-enabled tech to enhance astronaut communication during spacewalks
articles.author: The Hindu
articles.summary: The technology combines advanced antenna systems and Artificial Intelligence to solve non-verbal communication challenges in the extreme environment of space. It offers a robust solution to non- verbal challenges in space.    for the communication challenges of space in an extreme environment. for more information, visit: www.space-communication-technologie.com.

articles.title: AI needs to be better regulated to protect artists
articles.author: Lyla Maxwell
articles.summary: There should be strict laws and regulations for AI programs that generate art and better compensation provided to artists that it wrongs. Now there are almost none, which is hurting artists. Lyla Maxwell is a writer and a former AI developer. She is based in New York.

articles.title: OpenAI, Google paying thousands for YouTubers and content creators' videos to train AI models
articles.author: Cryptopolitan
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence companies are paying content creators thousands of dollars for their unused digital content. The content is used to train AI models and is then sold to other companies.      Â   i.e. OpenAI, Google, Alphabet Inc., Moonvalley, and others are among them.

articles.title: Beautiful.ai: Interview With CEO Jason Lapp About The Presentation Software Company
articles.author: Amit Chowdhry
articles.summary: Beautiful.ai is a presentation software that makes it easy to turn your ideas into beautiful visual stories. Jason Lapp was the CEO of marketing technology company Kiip and Chief Growth and Revenue Officer at Kantar. He joined Beautiful.ai as President and COO in 2021 and became CEO later that year.

articles.title: AI Is Like Tinkerbell: It Only Works If We Keep Clapping So It Doesn't Die
articles.summary: There's no limit to the promise of artificial intelligence. The future is a fickle thing. It can fail to materialize in the way envisioned. The industry in Silicon Valley is geared at getting us to believe hard and clap loud for emerging tech like AI and blockchain.

articles.title: OpenAI, Google paying thousands for YouTubers and content creators' videos to train AI models
articles.author: Hannah Collymore
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence companies are paying content creators for their unpublished content. The content is used to train their AI models. Some AI companies are in direct communication with the creators while others go through third-party licensing companies to negotiate terms with hundreds of content creators and buy their video footage in bulk.

articles.title: Fox News AI Newsletter: Tech leaders' message to Biden
articles.author: Fox News Staff
articles.summary: Tech industry leaders urge Biden not to cement a rule that could diminish US global leadership on AI. Sam Altman's sister accused him of sexually abusing her for nearly a decade. Berkeley professor sees the impact of H-1B visas and AI on students' job opportunities. Top tech is stealing the show at CES 2025.

articles.title: Dad Baffled When 6-Year-Old Daughter Turns Off AI Function on High Tech Doll and Plays With It Like Regular Toy
articles.summary: Alex Volkov's daughter doesn't like the AI toy he gave her for Christmas. Volkov is a self-styled "AI evangelist" and founder of a translation service powered by the tech. The toy is sold by Magical Toys for $200 a piece.

articles.title: Meet the startup pioneering AI-to-AI commerce—and why it matters
articles.author: Sam Becker
articles.summary: Nevermined has raised $4 million to develop a payment system that will allow for AI-to-AI transactions. Nevermined was founded by Don Gossen and Aitor Argomaniz, who previously founded Ocean Protocol, a decentralized data exchange protocol and platform.

articles.title: AI to displace millions of jobs by 2030
articles.author: Administrator
articles.summary: World Economic Forum's Future of Jobs report predicts 170 million new jobs will be created by the end of the decade and 92 million jobs displaced. Skills in AI, big data, and cybersecurity are expected to be in high demand. Service clerks, executive secretaries, payroll clerks, and graphic designers will face the biggest decline in numbers due to AI.

articles.title: 3 Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stocks to Buy Hand Over Fist in January
articles.author: Keithen Drury
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) investing isn't just for 2024, it's going to be a massive theme in 2025. Three AI stocks that investors should have on their radar are Meta Platforms, Salesforce (NYSE: CRM), and Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA). All three are large players in the tech space and have massive resources to throw at AI innovation.

articles.title: Chesapeake Lens: 'Snow Day' By Harry Greenspun
articles.author: Spy Desk
articles.summary: Snow days are great for students and teachers, but not for herons. The Spy Newspapers may periodically employ the assistance of artificial intelligence (AI) to enhance the clarity and accuracy of our content.      .   for their content.

articles.title: American Psychological Association Urges FTC to Investigate AI Chatbots Claiming to Offer Therapy
articles.author: Maggie Harrison Dupré
articles.summary: The American Psychological Association has sent a letter to the FTC asking it to investigate whether any chatbot companies are engaging in deceptive practices. Two lawsuits were filed in October and December concerning the welfare of minors who used the Google-funded AI companion app Character.AI, which is popular among kids and young people. It's unclear whether anything will come of the letter.

articles.title: Will Meta's Artificial Intelligence Agents Be a Game Changer in 2025?
articles.author: Keithen Drury
articles.summary: Meta Platforms (NASDAQ: META) is a social media platform with its own AI agent, Cicero, that competes in Diplomacy, a board game. Revenue rose 19% in the third quarter, with earnings per share (EPS) up 37% year over year. The stock is valued at 29 times trailing earnings and 24 times forward earnings, compared to the S&P 500 (SNPINDEX: ^GSPC) which is trading at 24.7 times.

articles.title: What's Working: Colorado companies show sweet tech at this year's CES expo in Las Vegas
articles.author: Tamara Chuang
articles.summary: This year's Consumer Technology Association show in Las Vegas was heavy on artificial intelligence. Colorado has a small presence on the CES show floor. Afference won an award last year for a wearable that uses neural haptics to simulate the sense of touch. Denver-based iterate.ai cohosted a private party at the Ole Red music club to show off its new partnership with Intel. OtterBox in Fort Collins unveiled new iPhone cases and phone straps. Lightship RV is a travel trailer for the electric vehicle age.

articles.title: Will 2025 Be the Year of Artificial Intelligence (AI) Agents? Nvidia's CEO Jensen Huang Thinks So.
articles.author: Keithen Drury
articles.summary: Jensen Huang is the CEO and founder of Nvidia, which makes the hardware that powers AI models. AI agents are the next step in integrating AI and using it for practical purposes. Nvidia is expected to grow revenue from $129 billion to nearly $200 billion in fiscal year 2026. Investors can still make a solid profit by investing in Nvidia today.

articles.title: Anthropic's chief scientist on 5 ways agents will be even better in 2025
articles.author: Melissa Heikkilä
articles.summary: Agents are the hottest thing in tech right now. Top firms from Google DeepMind to OpenAI to Anthropic are racing to augment large language models with the ability to carry out tasks by themselves. Anthropic showed off one of the most advanced agents yet: an extension of its Claude large language model called computer use. Jared Kaplan explains how agents are going to get better in 2025.

articles.title: 2 AI Stocks That Could Supercharge Your Portfolio
articles.author: Timothy Green
articles.summary: Cloudflare and DigitalOcean are investing heavily in AI. Cloudflare has a global network of AI-capable servers. DigitalOcean is working to extend its developer-friendly cloud platform into the AI space. The company has already won over more than 600,000 customers for its cloud computing services.

articles.title: I love technology. AI is creating a future we don't want.
articles.author: Nancy Kaffer
articles.summary: Last year Nancy Kaffer wrote a column on the future of AI, but she didn't finish it because of the busy election year. She's not a fan of artificial intelligence, because it's unreliable, unproven tech with environmental costs and ethical problems. She thinks we should stop using AI.

articles.title: As I See It: Living with artificial intelligence
articles.summary: Pundits are predicting the end of the world, but they don't specify how it will happen. We got things done without cursive writing for most of history. AI has tremendous value for research, science and design. It can free humans from tedious tasks so they can be more creative. It will change things for the better, but it will be abused by some people.

articles.title: How AI is helping an Israeli TV reporter speak clearly again
articles.author: Associated Press
articles.summary: Moshe Nussbaum, 71, was diagnosed with ALS two years ago. He lost his ability to speak clearly because of the disease. He had been a journalist for Channel 12 News for more than 40 years. Channel 12 will bring him back on air in the coming weeks as a commentator with the help of AI.

articles.title: Will we control AI, or will it control us? Top researchers weigh in
articles.author: CBC
articles.summary: Some of Canada's top AI researchers believe advanced artificial intelligence could be a utopia for humankind, if it doesn't eradicate our species first. Jeff Clune, a computer science professor at the University of British Columbia and the Canada CIFAR AI Chair at the Vector Institute, an AI research not-for-profit based in Toronto, is optimistic about the development of AI.

articles.title: Meta Faces Heat: Authors Claim AI Trained on Pirated Books
articles.author: Bit RSS
articles.summary: A group of authors has accused Meta of using pirated books to develop its artificial intelligence systems. Meta has denied the accusation.   Â. Â   i.e. they are not guilty of any crime.  i   in this case.

articles.title: I asked ChatGPT to name the best FTSE 100 stock and it picked this engineering giant
articles.author: The Motley Fool
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) platforms like ChatGPTT are already as clever as human beings. Past performance does not guarantee future results. Consult a financial advisor to ensure investments align with your personal financial situation and objectives.      Â

articles.title: I asked ChatGPT to name the best FTSE 100 stock and it picked this engineering giant
articles.author: Dr. James Fox
articles.summary: ChatGPT picked Rolls-Royce as the best FTSE 100 stock to invest in. James Fox is not convinced by ChatGPT's reasoning. He believes that the company's valuation metrics make it an interesting investment opportunity. The Motley Fool UK recommends Barclays Plc and Rolls- Royce.

articles.title: Techno-Hell: Human-Run Industries Go Way of Buffalo, One by One
articles.author: Ben Bartee
articles.summary: A chatbot from Sam Altman's company, OpenAI, outperformed human doctors in a diagnostic duel. Thai firm EHang has announced the first test run of its electric vertical takeoff and landing (OLV) aircraft in Bangkok. Chinese company is introducing flying taxis.

articles.title: Get tech-agile with AI-driven Hospitality Solutions from Agilysys
articles.author: Kanchan Nath
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is changing the hospitality industry. Hoteliers are using AI to enhance guest satisfaction and build guest loyalty. AI is also playing an increasingly vital role in personalising guest experiences. Agilysys exclusively delivers state-of-the-art software solutions and services that help organisations achieve High Return Hospitality.

articles.title: The AI-Powered Portable Toilet That can change people's lives
articles.author: Interesting Engineering
articles.summary: This AI-powered mobile toilet prioritizes sanitation and dignity. It features automated waste management, reducing caregiver workload and enhancing the caregiving experience. It is a life-changing innovation for patients and their caregivers. It's designed to improve hygiene and efficiency.

articles.title: CES 2025: Nvidia's CEO says 'useful' quantum computers are decades away — and the stocks tank
articles.summary: IonQ and Rigetti Computing's shares fell by more than 40% Wednesday morning. Quantum Computing, which announced a stock offering earlier this week to raise $100 million, saw its shares fall by about 49%. D-Wave Quantum saw shares fall around 47%. Google stock climbed more than 4% after it unveiled its latest quantum chip in December.

articles.title: Musk suggests real-world data ‘exhausted' for AI training
articles.author: Anadolu Agency
articles.summary: Elon Musk believes there is not enough data left to train AI models and that 'peak data' will soon be reached. During a recent livestream, he explained that nearly all of the human knowledge in AI training has been exhausted.    "We've exhausted basically the cumulative sum of human knowledge"

articles.title: ‘Embracing AI': Mississippi governor mandates creating policies for using artificial intelligence
articles.summary: The Mississippi Department of Internet Technology Services will create policy recommendations for using artificial intelligence in the public and private sectors under an executive order Gov. Tate Reeves issued on Wednesday. The policy recommendations must be fair, innovative, secure, safe, transparent, accountable and accessible. The content is only available to users who register with an online account.

articles.title: How Can We Stop AGI?
articles.author: https://discern.tv
articles.summary: Artificial General Intelligence (AGI) is advancing rapidly and poses serious questions about how society will adapt to it. Experts predict that by 2025, AGI could reach levels far beyond its current capabilities. People should prepare themselves to navigate this new world without losing control over their lives.

articles.title: PeakPicks AI Sets New Benchmarks for E-commerce Technology
articles.summary: PeakPicks AI is helping online sellers make smarter, faster, and more profitable decisions. The new AI model empowers online sellers with AI-driven insights featuring future sales, ROI, and net profit predictions for any product on Amazon at an 85-97% accuracy rate. PeakPicks offers a results-driven AI model with flexible pricing plans.

articles.title: Life-size AI robot girlfriend for ₹1.5 crore? Meet Aria, designed ‘specifically for companionship, intimacy'
articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: A tech company has launched its AI robot girlfriend for $150,000 (approximately ₹1.5 crore). According to CNET, the robot has 'facial expressions' and'realistic human' human features.    "MEET ARIA - THE FEMALE COMPANION ROBOT"

articles.title: TCL AiMe: cute companion robots of the future
articles.author: Interesting Engineering
articles.summary: TCL AiMe is a robot with advanced AI capabilities. AiMe learns and adapts to its environment, making it a lovable and interactive member of the family. TCL AiMe redefines companion robots with its adorable design and advanced AI abilities.

articles.title: AI Boosts Cervical Cancer Detection Efficiency
articles.author: Mirage News
articles.summary: Cervical cancer remains a major health threat for women globally, with the highest incidence in developing nations. WHO has set an ambitious target to screen 70% of women aged 35 to 45 by 2030. A review delves into AI's transformative potential in cervical cancer screening, focusing on its role in medical image recognition to identify abnormal cytology and neoplastic lesions. It also explores AI's potential to enhance colposcopy, a procedure traditionally hampered by subjective interpretation.

articles.title: They Took ‘Er Jobs!
articles.author: Ben Bartee
articles.summary: Chinese firm EHang has announced the first test run of its pilotless electric vertical takeoff and landing (eVTOL) aircraft in Bangkok, Thailand. The company is planning further flight tests of its EH216-S model on the islands of Phuket and Koh Samui by 2025.

articles.title: Meta is about to ruin WhatsApp with AI bots no one wants
articles.summary: WhatsApp is the world's largest chat app. It works on iPhone and Android and supports end-to-end encryption across platforms. Meta is testing the new interface in an Android beta version of WhatsApp. The new AI tab will include all sorts of AI chatbots to talk to.

articles.title: AI isn't going anywhere: Prompts to make life easier
articles.summary: Win a pair of Ray-Ban Meta smart glasses from ChatGPT for $20 a month. AI is not just for businesses, programmers, or the ultra tech-savvy. It's for anyone willing to give it a try. AI can't read your mind. It only knows what you tell it.

articles.title: AI could revolutionize cervical cancer screening and detection
articles.summary: Cervical cancer remains a major health threat for women globally, with the highest incidence in developing nations. WHO has set an ambitious target to screen 70% of women aged 35 to 45 by 2030. Researchers from the Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences and Peking Union Medical College have published a review of the current and future applications of artificial intelligence in improving cervical cancer screening methods in Cancer Biology & Medicine.

articles.title: New OpenAI job listings reveal the company's robotics plans
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: OpenAI is reviving its robotics division. Caitlin Kalinowski, the company's hardware director, shared details about its ambitious plans for the future of intelligent machines in a post on X. The company is developing its own robots with AI models developed in-house and integrating cutting-edge hardware and software. Its long-term vision is to achieve 'full-scale production' of its robots.

articles.title: Researchers improved AI agent performance on unfamiliar tasks using ‘Dungeons and Dragons'
articles.summary: Agents trained using the AgentRefine method and dataset performed better on diverse tasks and adapted to new scenarios when brought into new workflows. The researchers created personas, scripts for the agent to follow and challenges based on the tabletop roleplaying game Dungeons & Dragons.

articles.title: AI isn't going anywhere: Prompts to make life easier
articles.summary: Win a pair of Ray-Ban Meta smart glasses with a chatbot from ChatGPT for $20 a month. It's worth it for access to the better features and faster response times. AI is not just for businesses, programmers or the ultra tech-savvy, it's for anyone willing to try it.

articles.title: Health care leaders highlight AI use in health care at Bentonville conference
articles.author: Jeff Della Rosa
articles.summary: Alice L. Walton School of Medicine (AWSOM) and Stanford Medicine hosted Think Health: AI for Healthy Communities at Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art on Friday (Jan. 10). The invitation-only conference included national leaders in health care, technology, education and policymaking. The first session focused on health care access in rural areas.

articles.title: CES 2025: A Year Of AI Hype And Quiet Evolution
articles.author: Charlie Fink
articles.summary: This year's Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas was attended by 140,000 people. The highlight of the show was Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang's keynote. CES 2025 highlights the transformative role of AI and Gen AI, shaping industries like robotics, supply chains, and the future of energy.

articles.title: New OpenAI job listings reveal the company's robotics plans
articles.author: Kyle Wiggers
articles.summary: OpenAI disbanded its robotics department and brought it back. Caitlin Kalinowski, the company's new hardware director, revealed the new job descriptions for the team. The team will focus on "general-purpose," "adaptive," and "versatile" robots that can operate with human-like intelligence in "dynamic" settings.

articles.title: AI baldness scanner
articles.author: Interesting Engineering
articles.summary: The AFS 3D scanner leverages AI to revolutionize baldness diagnosis and treatment. It captures over 600 images of a person's scalp in under a minute. It provides accurate and precise assessments, paving the way for more effective solutions for hair loss patients.

articles.title: Finding Your Zen Via The Peaceful Mindful Advice Of Generative AI ChatGPT
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Generative AI can help you to find inner peace and calmness 24/7. Here are the details on how to best proceed with Generative AI and how to find your Zen in the world of artificial intelligence (AI) and how it works.

articles.title: South Koreans post record length of generative AI usage time in December: Data
articles.author: Beijing News
articles.summary: South Koreans used AI services for the longest amount of time last month. South Korean smartphone users spent a combined 900 million minutes on ChatGPT, A., WRTN, Perplexity, Microsoft, according to the Yonhap News Agency.

articles.title: PM Modi to attend AI Action Summit in France on February 10-11: French President Macron
articles.author: Beijing News
articles.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will attend the Artificial Intelligence Action Summit in France from February 10 to 11. French President Emmanuel Macron announced it on Friday. He said the US, China, and major emerging countries such as India have a key role to play in the AI field.

articles.title: Mark Zuckerberg says AI could soon do the work of Meta's midlevel engineers
articles.author: system
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg says Meta will start automating the work of midlevel software engineers this year. Meta may eventually outsource all coding on its apps to AI. In 2025, AI will be able to replace midlevel engineers and write all the code for all Meta's apps.

articles.title: Al Jazeera explores ethical integration in second edition of AI in Media conference
articles.author: Qatar Tribune
articles.summary: In an era where artificial intelligence (AI) is becoming more prevalent, Doha is concerned about the future of the industry. Doha thinks AI is a good thing.      Â   in an era when AI is more prevalent.

articles.title: Generative AI should be used to transform society, not put dogs in Van Gogh paintings
articles.author: Tech Radar
articles.summary: AI to augment and improve human society rather than take over human tasks.    for generative AI to improve society, not replace human tasks, rather than to take over humans tasks, as opposed to taking over human activities, as compared to them to augmenting human society.

articles.title: Elon Musk's Grok AI chatbot launches as standalone iOS app
articles.author: GCC Business News
articles.summary: Elon Musk's xAI has launched Grok AI chatbot as a standalone iOS app in the U.S. This app offers all the features available on the web version of the chatbot. It enables users to generate images, search the web and send messages.

articles.title: Starmer's 50-point plan for artificial intelligence revealed
articles.author: The Independent
articles.summary: New government plan involves training the next generation of AI experts at the UK's National AI Centre.   Â   for AI training at the centre is part of the new government plan to train AI experts in the UK. It's also part of a wider plan to improve education in AI.

articles.title: AI Is Like Tinkerbell: It Only Works If We Believe in It
articles.author: Futurism
articles.summary: There's no limit to the promises that the powerful make about artificial intelligence. Tech companies and their investors say that AI has the capacity to transform everything, making us more productive workers and more efficient learners, before eventually making us complain about work-life balance.

articles.title: 'Media professionals need to be upskilled to use AI tools'
articles.author: Gulf-Times
articles.summary: Zakir Ismailagic, Director of Training at Al Jazeera Media Institute gave an exclusive interview to Gulf Times on the sidelines of Al Jazeera Conference on Artificial Intelligence in Media. He talked about the future of AI and its transformative impact on the media industry.

articles.title: We Interviewed Aria, a $175K Almost-Human Robot at CES 2025
articles.author: CNET
articles.summary: Aria is powered by AI for her conversation skills, with 17 motors driving her facial expressions so she appears as human as possible. She is a blond, "female" robot named Aria with blonde hair and features a human-like features. She can talk to humans.

articles.title: Al Jazeera conference on AI in media kicks off
articles.author: Gulf-Times
articles.summary: The second Al Jazeera Conference on Artificial Intelligence in Media kicked off Saturday at the Grand Sheraton Hotel in Doha. The conference aims to explore the use of AI in newsrooms and its role in enhancing media content. It is attended by experts and specialists in AI, technology, and media.

articles.title: Elon Musk says that AI has already consumed all human-produced data to train itself and ...
articles.author: Independent Newsgroup
articles.summary: Elon Musk says AI models have already run out of human-created data and have turned to AI-generated information to teach itself. AI requires an enormous amount of resources, including endless water and an estimated $1 trillion in investor dollars, to train itself.

articles.title: Man uses AI to apply for 1000 jobs, gets 50 interview calls
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: An individual created an AI bot to manage his application process using the 'Get Employed' forum to help students and job seekers in the field of employment. AI is expected to rule almost all industries in the near future, as technology has taken over almost everything.

articles.title: Tech council aims for 480 petaflop computing speed
articles.author: Wu Po-hsuan
articles.summary: The National Science and Technology Council (NSTC) wants to boost the combined computing speed of the nation's supercomputers to 480 petaflops to develop Taiwan's sovereign artificial intelligence (AI) by boosting the combined processing power of the supercomputing units.

articles.title: Working Strategies: Best practices for companies using AI
articles.author: Pioneer Press
articles.summary: Amy Lindgren's column is the fifth in a series on AI and work. The column will appear the second Sunday of each month from September through August. Last month's column provided tips on using ChatGPT. Previous columns looked at work opportunities with artificial intelligence and AI use.

articles.title: Decode YouTube videos in a jiffy with Google Gemini: Here's how
articles.author: Indian Express
articles.summary: Google Gemini is the company's AI-powered product. It's based on Google's AI technology. It uses AI technology from Google's Google GVIMA system. It is powered by AI technology developed by Google's GVimma.

articles.title: THIS AI 'Robot Girlfriend' aims to provide companionship at INR 1.5 crore: Can technology replace human connection?
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: A tech company in the US has created an AI robot that can help people beat loneliness, by being a companion to them. The robot is modular and you can take the faces off it in under five seconds, and create a whole new robot off the same chassis.

articles.title: S. Koreans post record length of generative AI usage time in December: data
articles.author: Urdu Point
articles.summary: South Koreans used artificial intelligence services for the longest amount of time last month. South Korean smartphone users spent a combined 900 million minutes on AI services last month, according to Yonhap News Agency.      .   i.e. UrduPoint, Pakistan Point News and WAM.

articles.title: This AI titan's valuation shot up by more than 3 times within a year, and ...
articles.author: The Economic Times
articles.summary: 2023 and 2024 have been great years for the world of artificial technology. OpenAI has become one of the biggest beneficiaries of this technology.   Â. Â  .   in the future, OpenAI will be able to develop artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Meet the startup pioneering AI-to-AI commerce—and why it matters
articles.author: Fast Company
articles.summary: As AI systems become more ubiquitous, they will interact with other AI systems, requesting data, resources, or functionalities. They will need to pay for those requests, which will require transactions. The future of commerce isn't just about humans trading with humans anymore, it's about AI agents transacting with each other. We need new payment systems to facilitate that.

articles.title: Local View: Artificial intelligence shaping the world — for better or worse
articles.author: Duluth News Tribune
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is no longer confined to the pages of science fiction. It is defining our lives in profound and sometimes unsettling ways. It can decide who gets hired, diagnose diseases, and even decide outcomes in the theater of war. It touches nearly every aspect of our existence.

articles.title: From AI to Epstein, Glenn Beck unveils his top predictions for 2025
articles.author: Blazetv Staff
articles.summary: Glenn Beck predicts that the internet as we know it will be destroyed and reborn in 2025. He also predicts that AI will be integrated into everyday life to such a level that it will force humanity on a 'journey of losing what it means to be human'

articles.title: Large Data Center Planned for Ozaukee County
articles.author: Nick Rommel
articles.summary: Cloverleaf Infrastructure is working with the City of Port Washington to build a data center on over 1,000 acres of farmland north of the city. Microsoft's planned data center campus in Mount Pleasant, Wisconsin, is already under construction. Town of PortWashington is considering creating a tax-increment financing district to pay for sewer and water extensions to the data center.

articles.title: Elon Musk says AI has already gobbled up all human-produced data to train itself and now relies on hallucination-prone synthetic data
articles.summary: Elon Musk warns that AI has already used up all human-produced data to train itself and now relies on synthetic data. AI is estimated to cost an estimated $1 trillion worth of investor dollars and takes a lot of resources to develop and train itself.
